DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine combination two drug ( bimatoprost timolol ) deliver surface eye 10 week well lower intraocular pressure ( IOP ) either drug deliver alone .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Evaluate Efficacy Safety Fixed Combination Ocular Insert Subjects With Open-angle Glaucoma Ocular Hypertension
DOC.criteria: Key Written inform consent At least 18 year age Diagnosis eye either primary openangle glaucoma ( POAG ) ocular hypertension Best correcteddistance visual acuity score equivalent 20/80 well Stable visual field Central corneal thickness 490 620 micrometer Inclusion Criteria Randomization Visit : IOP eye ≥ 23 mmHg T=0hr , ≥ 20 mmHg T=4hr T=8hr . Intereye IOP difference ≤ 5.0 mmHg T=0hr , T=4hr T=8hr . IOP eye ≤ 30 mmHg T=0hr , T=4hr T=8hr . Key Any known contraindication prostaglandin analog ( latanoprost , travoprost , bimatoprost , tafluprost ) timolol A cardiac pulmonary condition opinion Investigator would contraindicate use topical betablocker Use agent know substantial effect IOP plan study period ( e.g . betablockers ) Cuptodisc ratio great 0.8 Significant risk angle closure due pupil dilation , define Shaffer classification less Grade 2 base gonioscopy Ocular , orbital , and/or eyelid surgery type within past six ( 6 ) month screen date Laser surgery glaucoma / ocular hypertension one ( 1 ) eye within last six ( 6 ) month Past history incisional surgery glaucoma time Past history corneal refractive surgery Corneal abnormality would interfere accurate IOP reading applanation tonometer Current participation investigational drug device study participation study within 7 day Screening Inability adequately evaluate retina Subjects require contact lens use study period . Subjects currently punctal occlusion Pregnant , lactate childbearing potential use medically acceptable form birth control
